pattern_description: Series of increasingly large online purchases within 24 hours, starting with small test transactions. Purchases made from IP addresses in different countries.

method: Changed shipping address just before purchase
pattern_description: Account credentials changed within 48 hours of large purchase. Shipping address changed to a freight forwarding service. Contact email and phone also changed.
indicators: Unusually large purchase compared to history

method: Rapid small transactions to test card validity
pattern_description: Multiple small transactions (under $10) in rapid succession to test if card is valid. Often followed by larger purchases if the small ones succeed.
Customer makes purchase, receives goods, then disputes the charge claiming they didn't make the purchase or didn't receive the goods.
indicators: History of chargebacks with same customer

pattern_description: Merchant processes unauthorized recurring charges or multiple charges for the same purchase. May be a fake storefront or a compromised merchant account.

method: Testing card number combinations with valid BIN ranges
pattern_description: Fraudster uses valid Bank Identification Numbers (BINs) and generates possible card numbers, then tests them with small transactions to find valid ones.
indicators: Multiple attempts with similar card numbers
Transactions from unusual or changing locations

method: Social engineering to obtain card details
pattern_description: Fraudster contacts cardholder posing as bank or service representative, tricks them into revealing card details, then makes high-value purchases for services that don't require physical verification.
indicators: Transactions soon after customer service calls
Different transaction location than cardholder's history

method: Card details stolen via physical skimming device
pattern_description: Card details stolen via skimming device at ATM, gas station, or restaurant. Duplicate card created and used for in-store purchases, often in high-end retail stores.
indicators: Card present transaction without chip use
Transaction in different geographical area than cardholder
Multiple retail purchases in short timeframe

method: Phishing email leads to credential theft
pattern_description: Cardholder receives phishing email impersonating their bank or a service, enters credentials on fake site, resulting in account takeover. Fraudster then makes online purchases in digital goods that can be quickly resold.
indicators: Login from unusual IP address or device
Multiple purchases of gift cards or digital currency
Unusual browsing patterns prior to purchase

method: Fraudster lists non-existent items on marketplace
pattern_description: Fraudster lists non-existent or heavily discounted items on a marketplace, accepts payment from buyer, then uses stolen cards to purchase and ship the actual items from legitimate retailers. Cardholder discovers unauthorized charge, resulting in chargeback.
indicators: Multiple shipping addresses different from billing address
